availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, carpenter. Tennessee native. Son of Samuel D. Butts and Elizabeth Butts. Married to Martha B. Butts. Father of Frances E. Butts, James M. Butts, and Jennie Butts. Farmer in Weakley County, Tennessee, in 1850. Carpenter in Paducah, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Daniel W. Hicks as a laborer in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Weakley County, District 11, p. 369B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, District 1, p. 937.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Birmingham, p. 243B.
Find A Grave, "Samuel W. Butts (1832-1890)," Memorial #53676517, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53676517 (accessed January 26, 2021).
